title: KNOCKED LOOSE’s Jimmy Kimmel Live! Performance Ignited “Outrage” Among The Show’s Regular Viewers
description: “Quite frankly I think the Kimmel show and its staff should make a formal apology.”
author: Joel Barrios
byline: By Joel Barrios Published 1 day ago
excerpt: “Quite frankly I think the Kimmel show and its staff should make a formal apology.”
text: Knocked Loose’s performance on Jimmy Kimmel Live! this past Tuesday (November 26) has ignited a firestorm of social media complaints amongst the show’s usual viewership, ranging from the absurd to the downright comical. Several outraged viewers shared their grievances, painting the performance as a horrifying assault on their senses – yeah, we can laugh about that for a minute. According to The Mirror, one particularly dramatic Facebook user recounted the show’s impact on their teenage son, writing, “I was sitting on the couch with my son who is an ADOLESCENT waiting to see the musical guest because we like the nice music the show usually books. By the third or fourth ‘JUNT’ from the guitars my son was in tears. He doesn’t like scary things and quite frankly I think the Kimmel show and its staff should make a formal apology.” Another “keyboard-warrior” detractor echoed the age-old metal critique: the lyrics were unintelligible, and the screaming was unbearable. “If I have to read the lyrics I’ll just read them and not listen to someone yell them”. Another frustrated commenter expressed disdain for the chaotic energy, saying, “This what not enjoyable. And you can’t understand more than 5% of the lyrics. Moshing doesn’t not equal dancing.” The confusion in their typos only seemed to amplify the melodrama. A “music expert” went on to say it wasn’t even music: "How do I sing along with this??? Lol sounds just like a screaming frenzy to me!! Actually starting to hurt my ears!! People who listen to this have no room to complain about crying babies or screaming two-year-olds taking a tantrum!! Ha ha unreal!!! They call this music Jimmy??" As you can imagine, on the other side of the spectrum, many took to  X (formerly Twitter) and praised the moment as a watershed event for heavy music on national television. One fan highlighted the potential impact on young viewers, tweeting, “Some kid is gonna be up late tonight casually watching Jimmy Kimmel and hear Knocked Loose for the first time and they’re gonna say, ‘I wanna start a fucking band like that’ and change their whole life. That’s how important this is.” One YouTube commenter summed it up when saying: "I’m an old guy. I don’t listen to this style of music. But I can appreciate the primal emotion it takes to make it. Haters are losers. These kids rocked it." Knocked Loose’s Kimmel appearance comes amid a wave of recognition for the band. Just weeks ago, Suffocate earned a nomination for the 2025 Grammy Award for Best Metal Performance, putting them in the same category as heavyweights like Metallica, Judas Priest, and Gojira. The winner will be revealed at the February 2 ceremony in Los Angeles. Want More Metal? html:
Knocked Loose’s performance on Jimmy Kimmel Live! this past Tuesday (November 26) has ignited a firestorm of social media complaints amongst the show’s usual viewership, ranging from the absurd to the downright comical. Several outraged viewers shared their grievances, painting the performance as a horrifying assault on their senses – yeah, we can laugh about that for a minute.

According to The Mirror, one particularly dramatic Facebook user recounted the show’s impact on their teenage son, writing, “I was sitting on the couch with my son who is an ADOLESCENT waiting to see the musical guest because we like the nice music the show usually books. By the third or fourth ‘JUNT’ from the guitars my son was in tears. He doesn’t like scary things and quite frankly I think the Kimmel show and its staff should make a formal apology.”

Another “keyboard-warrior” detractor echoed the age-old metal critique: the lyrics were unintelligible, and the screaming was unbearable. “If I have to read the lyrics I’ll just read them and not listen to someone yell them”. Another frustrated commenter expressed disdain for the chaotic energy, saying, “This what not enjoyable. And you can’t understand more than 5% of the lyrics. Moshing doesn’t not equal dancing.” The confusion in their typos only seemed to amplify the melodrama.

A “music expert” went on to say it wasn’t even music: "How do I sing along with this??? Lol sounds just like a screaming frenzy to me!! Actually starting to hurt my ears!! People who listen to this have no room to complain about crying babies or screaming two-year-olds taking a tantrum!! Ha ha unreal!!! They call this music Jimmy??"

As you can imagine, on the other side of the spectrum, many took to  X (formerly Twitter) and praised the moment as a watershed event for heavy music on national television. One fan highlighted the potential impact on young viewers, tweeting, “Some kid is gonna be up late tonight casually watching Jimmy Kimmel and hear Knocked Loose for the first time and they’re gonna say, ‘I wanna start a fucking band like that’ and change their whole life. That’s how important this is.”

One YouTube commenter summed it up when saying: "I’m an old guy. I don’t listen to this style of music. But I can appreciate the primal emotion it takes to make it. Haters are losers. These kids rocked it."

Knocked Loose’s Kimmel appearance comes amid a wave of recognition for the band. Just weeks ago, Suffocate earned a nomination for the 2025 Grammy Award for Best Metal Performance, putting them in the same category as heavyweights like Metallica, Judas Priest, and Gojira. The winner will be revealed at the February 2 ceremony in Los Angeles.
